channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: California euthanizes 4 gray wolves after 'unprecedented' surge in livestock kills
item.description: California wildlife officials have been working to mitigate the impact of the state's rebounding wolf population on its ranchers. The Northern California wolves that were euthanized had become dependent on cattle for food.
item.content:encoded: California wildlife officials have been working to mitigate the impact of the state's rebounding wolf population on its ranchers. The Northern California wolves that were euthanized had become dependent on cattle for food.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Rott

item.title: German police bust an art forgery ring trying to sell fake Picasso, Rembrandt works
item.description: The alleged leader of the scheme, a 77-year-old German man from Bavaria, also tried to sell counterfeit works supposedly by Frida Kahlo, Amadeo Modigliani and Peter Paul Rubens, authorities say.
item.content:encoded:
The alleged leader of the scheme, a 77-year-old German man from Bavaria, also tried to sell counterfeit works supposedly by Frida Kahlo, Amadeo Modigliani and Peter Paul Rubens, authorities say.

(Image credit: Matthias Balk)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: US and China say trade deal drawing closer as Trump and Xi prepare for meeting
item.description: China's top trade negotiator, Li Chenggang, told reporters the two had reached a "preliminary consensus," while Trump's treasury secretary, Scott Bessent, said there was "a very successful framework."
item.content:encoded:
China's top trade negotiator, Li Chenggang, told reporters the two had reached a "preliminary consensus," while Trump's treasury secretary, Scott Bessent, said there was "a very successful framework."

(Image credit: Vincent Thian/)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why the ACA needs young people â€” and the looming 'death spiral' for health insurance
item.description: Young and healthy people who get Affordable Care Act health insurance are thinking about dropping coverage next year, as the government remains shutdown over health care tax credits.
item.content:encoded:
Young and healthy people who get Affordable Care Act health insurance are thinking about dropping coverage next year, as the government remains shutdown over health care tax credits.

(Image credit: Selena Simmons-Duffin)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Suspects arrested over the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre museum in Paris
item.description: The Paris prosecutor said on Sunday that a number of suspects have been arrested over the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre museum in Paris last weekend.
item.content:encoded:
The Paris prosecutor said on Sunday that a number of suspects have been arrested over the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre museum in Paris last weekend.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Shooting leaves 1 dead and 6 hurt at historically Black university's homecoming fest in Pennsylvania
item.description: One person was killed and six more were wounded in a shooting Saturday night at Pennsylvania's Lincoln University.
item.content:encoded:
One person was killed and six more were wounded in a shooting Saturday night at Pennsylvania's Lincoln University.

(Image credit: Matt Slocum)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump attends ceasefire ceremony with Thailand and Cambodia during Malaysia visit
item.description: Thailand and Cambodia have signed an expanded ceasefire agreement during a ceremony attended by President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Thailand and Cambodia have signed an expanded ceasefire agreement during a ceremony attended by President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Mohd Rasfan)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How the craft flour movement could be a boon to farmers and Indian Country
item.description: As U.S. wheat farmers face painful losses in the global market due to President Trump's policies, one domestic flour mill on a reservation in Oregon is expanding its production twelvefold.
item.content:encoded:
As U.S. wheat farmers face painful losses in the global market due to President Trump's policies, one domestic flour mill on a reservation in Oregon is expanding its production twelvefold.

(Image credit: Photo courtesy of Andrew Snyder, Cairnspring Mills)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Hurricane Melissa threatens life-threatening flooding in Jamaica, Haiti and Cuba
item.description: The storm's slow movement is expected to bring a deluge of rain to multiple countries in the Caribbean, and prolong its dangerous impacts over a period of several days.
item.content:encoded:
The storm's slow movement is expected to bring a deluge of rain to multiple countries in the Caribbean, and prolong its dangerous impacts over a period of several days.

(Image credit: Ricardo Makyn)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: The White House movie theater demolition ends a storied era in presidential history
item.description: The vintage movie venue was destroyed this week as part of the Trump administration's plan to build a new $300 million ballroom. Former President Bill Clinton called it the office's "best perk."
item.content:encoded:
The vintage movie venue was destroyed this week as part of the Trump administration's plan to build a new $300 million ballroom. Former President Bill Clinton called it the office's "best perk."

(Image credit: The White House)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman
